Delivers a critical speech that challenges his own industry and colleagues rather than choosing a safe or pleasing message.
Sits quietly with head down, cigarette dangling, not engaging actively in the lighthearted banter and jokes among colleagues.
Engages in thoughtful discussion about potential stories, recognizing the significance of Milo Radulovich’s case and suggesting sending reporters to investigate.

Does not immediately know all facts (e.g., who brought charges) but pursues the story methodically.

Does not show any dismissive or harsh behavior toward colleagues during disagreement, instead maintains a calm and reasoned tone.
